national_indicators_available:
• Attributable Todesfälle infolge einer Langzeit-Exposition gegenüber Feinstaub (PM₂,₅) in der Bevölkerung ab 25 Jahren
  • DALYs infolge einer Langzeit-Exposition gegenüber Feinstaub (PM₂,₅) in der Bevölkerung ab 25 Jahren
  • Attributable Todesfälle infolge einer Langzeit-Exposition gegenüber Feinstaub (PM₂,₅) in der Bevölkerung ab 25 Jahren nach Art der Erkrankung
  • DALYs infolge einer Langzeit-Exposition gegenüber Feinstaub (PM₂,₅) in der Bevölkerung ab 25 Jahren nach Art der Erkrankung
comparison_sdg: Die Zeitreihen entsprechen nicht den globalen Metadaten, bieten aber zusätzliche Informationen.
indicator_name: Sterblichkeitsrate infolge von Verschmutzung der Raum- bzw. Außenluft
target_name: Bis 2030 die Zahl der Todesfälle und Erkrankungen aufgrund gefährlicher Chemikalien und der Verschmutzung und Verunreinigung von Luft, Wasser und Boden erheblich verringern
un_designated_tier: Tier I
source_url_text_3: 12-Monats-Prävalenz der bekannten chronisch obstruktiven Lungenerkrankung (COPD) in Deutschland
source_url_text_3b: 12-Monats-Prävalenz des bekannten Diabetes mellitus in Deutschland
source_url_text_3c: 12-Monats-Prävalenz von Schlaganfall oder chronischen Beschwerden infolge eines Schlaganfalls in Deutschland

en.national_indicators_available:
• Attributable deaths due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (PM₂.₅) in the population aged 25 years and older
  • DALYs due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (PM₂.₅) in the population aged 25 years and older
  • Attributable deaths due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter(PM₂.₅) in the population aged 25 years and older by type of disease
  • DALYs due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (PM₂.₅) in the population aged 25 years and older by type of disease
en.comparison_sdg: The time series are not compliant with the global metadata, but provide additional information.
en.goal_meta_national_link_text: Metadata on the presented time series
en.indicator_name: Mortality rate attributed to household and ambient air pollution
en.target_name: By 2030, substantially reduce the number of deaths and illnesses from hazardous chemicals and air, water and soil pollution and contamination
en.un_designated_tier: Tier I
en.source_url_text_1: Health relevance of fine particulate matter (only available in German)
en.source_url_text_2b: Population in 100 meters grid (only available in German)
en.source_url_text_3: 12-month prevalence of known chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) in Germany (only available in German)
en.source_url_text_3b: 12-month prevalence of known diabetes mellitus in Germany (only available in German)
en.source_url_text_3c: 12-month prevalence of stroke or chronic complaints resulting from stroke in Germany (only available in German)

footer_fields.series: attributable deaths due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (pm2.5) in the population aged 25 years and older
footer_fields.label: Note
footer_fields.value: The confidence interval (CI) is shown as a dashed line in the chart.

footer_fields.series: dalys due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (pm2.5) in the population aged 25 years and older
footer_fields.label: Notes
footer_fields.value:
• The confidence interval (CI) is shown as a dashed line in the chart.
• Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs): Number of healthy life years lost due to death and morbidity caused by diseases that can be statistically attributed to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (PM₂.₅).

footer_fields.series: dalys due to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (pm2.5) in the population aged 25 years and older by type of disease
footer_fields.label: Note
footer_fields.value: Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs): Number of healthy life years lost due to death and morbidity caused by diseases that can be statistically attributed to long-term exposure to fine particulate matter (PM₂.₅).
